channel.title: Client Wont Change IP
channel.description: Allright so I changed Ip address in Gui.java and I checked in Client.java but that just links to the gui, I checked the imports and it doesnt import gui.java and was wondering if i had to or what.This is not my first time running a server. I check Runelocus status checker and yes the server is online but either the client or server defuses to connect. When checking the cmd for running the server on the vps it doesnt show any attempt of my connecting. Please if anyone can teach me or atleast help me out that would be great.

item.title: Client Wont Change IP
item.dc:creator: @samoankilla samoankilla
item.description:
@samoankilla wrote:

Kk found the UID for the client but the UID for the client.java server side is kinda confusing. Also Server didnt have the file RS2LOGINPROTOCOL. This is a Bluurrs client btw.

		int junk = inStream.readDWord();
			playerName = inStream.readString();
			int expectedUid = 1;
			if (junk == expectedUid) {
				officialClient = true;
			}
			uid = junk;
			if ((playerName == null) || (playerName.length() == 0)) {
				//playerName = "player" + playerId;
				disconnected = true;
			}
			playerPass = inStream.readString();

			try {
				playerServer = inStream.readString();
			} catch (Exception e) {
				playerServer = "127.0.0.1";
			}

			playerName = playerName.toLowerCase();
			playerPass = playerPass.toLowerCase();
}
			if ((highest < 1) || (num44 == 7)) {
				if (uid > 1)
					server.bannedUid.add(new Integer(uid));
				isKicked = true;
				break;
			}
			
	public int loadgame(String playerName, String playerPass) {
		for (Integer bUid : server.bannedUid) {
			if (uid == bUid.intValue()) {
				return 4;
			}

UID For Client (Signlink.Java)

    private static final int getuid(String s)
    {
      return 74558541;
    }

Please contact me on MSN to make things go faster: Jakeierome@live.com

item.title: Client Wont Change IP
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

signlink.java search uid
client.java search stream.writeDWord(signlink.uid);

server sided, in RS2LoginProtocolDecoder, search for int uid = in.getInt();

and if the numbers aren’t the same, change them to a desired number that you will remember.

Read full topic
